item.title: Parameters parsing for python applications
item.description: command line arguments is a standard and one of the most common ways to pass parameters to a python script. There exist a list of python libraries that help with that task. Here I am going to list some of them. argparse The default choice for the python developer. The module is included in python standard library and comes together with any python distribution. Example of usage: #!/usr/bin/env bash import argparse def hello(count, name): """Simple program that greets NAME for a total of COUNT times.
